titles.title: Armenian Protection Act of 2023
Armenian Protection Act of 2023
Armenian Protection Act of 2023
A bill to repeal Freedom Support Act section 907 waiver authority with respect to assistance to Azerbaijan.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.
Senate Committee on Foreign Relations discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote.

reference.label: text of amendment in the nature of a substitute

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

term.name: Presidents and presidential powers, Vice Presidents

bill.summary:
Armenian Protection Act of 2023
This bill restricts providing U.S. foreign assistance to the government of Azerbaijan in FY2024 or FY2025.
Current law prohibits providing certain foreign assistance to the government of Azerbaijan, but also authorizes the President to waive this prohibition for specified reasons, such as if the foreign assistance is necessary to support U.S. efforts to counter international terrorism. This bill bars the President from providing this waiver with respect to funds made available for FY2024 or FY2025.
